name: The Leela Mumbai

reviews.text: Leela is an oasis, as many has written before.
reviews.title: Best hotel I ever stayed in

likes.disliked: — The alarm clock was set on the wrong time, which woke me up an hour early. I should have checked of course.

reviews.text: If your a westerner in India for the first time its a very good place to stay. You get to calm your somewhat jagged nerve in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is gorgeous, bathroom, sheets everything. Clean, cool, quiet. Balm for a stressed soul. It is very pricey though. And very far from the center. I stayed here to be close to the office.
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chinese restaurant on the premises is one of the best in Mumbai, and Chinese is popular. But try and eat other places then the hotel as well. Even though it is good enough to eat there every day.
reviews.title: Could have been better

reviews.text: International standard close to the airport. Easy transfer with hotel private car.it is one hour drive to the center. Multiple restaurants and very large offer for breakfast. By the way if you fly from paris i believe there is a much better option than the air france fligth. In business you really feel there you have been ripped off. No comment on the most expensive ticket price but no lounge, oldest movie system in the plane and you have a 3 am departure. Dubai transit is probably the best option. Air france will loose another platinum customer.
reviews.title: Good airport stay in mumbai

reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at. The pool and sauna are very well maintained and serviced. Please keep on mind that smoking is not allowed everywhere in the garden, there are a couple of tables which you should be located at while you are smoking. You will get surprised if you book the hotel shuttle from the airport when you see the car!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for Mumbai!

reviews.text: Excellent facilities (shopping, onsite restaurants, wifi) and high quality rooms make this a great hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and proximity to the airport make this a good choice for the day/night in between connecting flights.
reviews.title: Perhaps the best hotel in Mumbai with a truly beautiful campus

reviews.text: We ate at the Jamavar Indian restaurant which was more expensive than any other restaurants we visited in India (inside or outside of hotels) during our 8 day trip, but quality was good.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel near the international airport in Mumbai.

reviews.text: This is a fantastic place to stay if you get the chance. Pure luxury and with some fantastic restaurants and bars. The is also an external disco attached to the hotel which we had the pleasure of attending. They operate a pick up service form the Airport which I would recommend as getting across Mumbai in a taxi can be an effort. The pool and gardens all look great. The price for what you get is exceptionally good, but remember its not central which isn't a big deal as the reception an organise to get you into town. The hotel is so clean it shines and this stands for every part of the hotel, rooms, lobby, bars, pool and so on.
reviews.title: Luxury at its best..

reviews.text: Take the chance to stay here if you can. On a negative point I fell ill during my stay (not due to the hotel) and asked twice for a doctor to come to my room. Unfortunately to no avail. So for this reason its loses some points. Its all very well if your hotel is luxurious but if you need a doctor and none arrive, well there's something to be said for customer service here. hence it does not get and "Excellent"
reviews.title: Not a good experience
Excellent Stay
reviews.text: Stayed hear after 6 weeks travelling in India. We stayed in a range of accomodation and the Leela was probably one of the worst. Staff were rude (particularly front desk) and unhelpful. Food was desperate considering this is a supposedly 5* hotel. There are so many other hotels in this area, near the airport, that I won't be staying here again.

I was in Mumbai on a business visit where our local office booked a 3 Star hotel @ $ 207 a night. A pathetic hotel for no value of money !!! I shifted to Leela the next morning and stayed 4 days with a very good staying experience. What more can you expect if the receptionist welcomes you on the third day calling your name !!! Truly an excellent place to stay
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: The moment we walked out of the airport there was someone from the hotel waiting to drive us at no extra charge. (complimentary car service to any destination in and around Mumbai)
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.text: This was my 3rd stay at the Leela Mumbai, what i love about the property is pool side garden which is very refreshing. This time i had got a pool facing room. Howver the room size is very small, and found the red carpet on wooden flooring very stupid.
reviews.title: good pool and garden,small rooms
Uncomfortable stay
reviews.text: Overall nice hotel, though the room at times becomes suffocating. The best part is the day light bathroom.

It's finally showing it's age... one just needs to unfortunately take the stairs down instead of the Lift. Casual attitude (a room service boy actually had the gall to snigger half way out of the room). Furnishing looks & feels dated.. you enter the hotel & one word comes in mind .. sad & old. The beds were one of the most uncomfortable we encountered in our journey. They need to look at the Hyatt or the Intercontinental on Marine Drive how to benchmark Luxury & comfort.
reviews.title: impressive airport hotel

reviews.text: Probably won't stay again.
reviews.title: Five Star Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed only one night in the Leela Kempinski Hotel , but was very impressed by the room that I stayed in. $170.- for a standard room inclusive of tax and a great breakfast buffet was more than a great rate for me since I had to pay a silly amount of $ 200.- for a comparable similiar room (delux) in the Hyatt Delhi.
reviews.title: Don't get screwed by their Onlline Reservations website

reviews.text: Once again I stayed at the Leela in Mumbai. This time I went for a Royal Club room and was suitably impressed.
reviews.title: Never fails to impress

reviews.text: I gave them my flight arrival times and was met in and whisked to the hotel in one of their nice BMW's to the hotel... then up to the 8th floor to check in...All very VIP style!
reviews.title: love the Leela!

reviews.text: Personal butler was on call...had my shoes cleaned!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel and great hospitable staff

reviews.text: Free snacks and soft drinks around the clock in the Club lounge.... although some of the delicious offerings were not refilled even when requested and more would have been nice!!!
reviews.title: Still among Mumbai's best hotels

reviews.text: All in all a great stay as usual the Leela.
reviews.title: A bit of a let down

reviews.text: Stayed here one night before departing from Bombay. Although the price was on a European standard, and not Indian, it was definately worth it. I booked through the hotel's website, was fetched from the airport as requested in a nice airconditioned car, staff was excellent, room was great with a huge bed, lots of extra goodies (complimentary cookies, fruit, large LCD TV, etc.). And, it was less than 10 minutes from both the national and international airports. Lots of gift shops in the hotel. Recomended.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I am writing to inform you about my recent stay at the Leela in Mumbai. My family and I arrived there around the 29th Dec'06 to stay for a few days prior to our departure for the UK. We had specifically requested an extra bed since there were four of us, 2 adults and 2 children. This was confirmed by The Leela. On arrival we found out that there were no such arrangements available by them and furthermore the staff did little or nothing to assist. Despite several requests nothing was sorted. My wife and I took in turns to sleep on the couch for the 2 nights we were there. We were absolutely appalled by this treatment. Our misery did not end there. We decided to have our evening meals in the hotel and on both occassions our food was brought out wrong, not what we had ordered! we then had to wait a further 45 minutes before our correct food actually arrived! On our final morning of departure we sat for brekfast oredered our requirements and 40 minutes later nothing had arrived. In the meantime two other tables which had arrived after us had already been served. When I finally complained the staff did not even know what my order was and were playing guessing games as to what they thought my order was, which was simply 2 fried eggs! How difficult is that to accomplish? As a matter of fact we were not the only ones in the hotel who had complaints. Over our two day stay there we experienced 3 other seperate unrelated incidents where the guests of the hotel were completely appalled by the servoce and staff had got things wrong. We had just returned from a splendid holiday from Goa and decided to spend our final two days in Mumbai and our whole holiday was ruined by the uncaring incompetence of the Leela Kampinski in Mumbai. We have promised ourselves that we will never ever stay there again and furthermore I will use every avenue available to me to publicise the rotten treatment and appalling service we received at this hotel. Never again! Leela Kampinski are useless and on the face of it show that they are a top class hotel, they are not! They are defrauding cheats after clients money and not forthcoming with quality of service. Their pathetic attitude will never let them excel and in the long term will be doomed to failure as they are already well and truly on that path. I have been disgusted and very badly let down by The Leela Kampinski in Mumbai and vowed never to stay there again!
reviews.title: Appalling Hotel - Ruined our Holiday!

reviews.text: Just returned from a great trip to Mumbai - my first (and it won't be my last.) I stayed at the Leela for the better part of my journey, and stayed at the Taj President for the last bit. The Leela was exceptional. Here are some bullet points of what I liked/disliked:
reviews.title: A distance from Colaba, Fort -- but that's OK

likes.liked: — It's a good place to decompress after a long day in Mumbai
likes.disliked: — It's a bit of a distance from the city, but I wasn't in a hurry while there

reviews.text: --Very clean and nicely decorated/modern.
reviews.title: Very short stay but very helpful

reviews.text: --Rooms are a good size, comfy for two people.
reviews.title: 2nd stay, not as good as first

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Leela a number of times and have never been disappointed. From the poolside buffet and great room service, to their fantastic efforts to ward off the mozzies and look after your every need.
reviews.title: Great hotel, close to the airport with 5 star service

reviews.text: Shopping, security, relaxation are all catered for.
reviews.title: Consistanly maintaining high standard of service and comfort.

reviews.text: Great if you have work nearby or are en-route from or to the airport. Your every need will be catered for!
reviews.title: Exceeds expectations

reviews.text: When I had an issue with noise - people servicing the rooms opposite in the early hours - I received a huge apology and complimentary drinks in my room - a careful touch.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Mumbai

reviews.text: As an infrequent guest (about 2 times per year), I am impressed by the hotel's positive attitude toward me as a VIP guest.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: The Leela Mumbai is a magnificent hotel. I have now stayed there 3 times and it gets better every time. The hotel meet you at the airport and it's a 10 minute drive to the hotel. I have always stayed in a pool view room. The service is magnificent and the facilities are perfect. Several restaurants, a pool, gym and spa. The staff cannot do enough for you. It's worth noting that the hotel is not near the main tourist districts and the food/drinks are quite pricey but I would not stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Amazing service at this wonderful hotel
Such a great location
reviews.text: Leela palace, Mumbai very nice location to stay. Food is good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a deluxe room in the new part of the hotel and it was nice but small for what we paid.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: The pool is one of the greatest pools in the world, including Thailand/Caribbean paradise locations - something about the haven in the chaos and the architecture
reviews.title: Great place to stay after a long trip here

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight on way to Aurangabad due to its location near the airport terminals.
reviews.title: Excellent place near to the airport

description: Within the bustling heart of India’s commercial and entertainment mecca lays one of the finest luxury hotels in Mumbai. Nestled within the tranquillity of 11 acres of lush landscaped gardens and cascading waterfalls, The Leela Mumbai is a shimmering beacon amongst Mumbai hotels.Only five minutes away from Chatrapati Shivaji International Airport and 15 minutes from Mumbai’s domestic airport, the Leela Mumbai is well equipped with world class facilities and warm, friendly service providing the ideal gateway from which to explore northern Mumbai’s commercial hub.
